description: Demolition of an existing commercial unit (B1 use) and the erection of two new semi-detached dwellings (C3)
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

A sample of the facing materials to be utilised in the development hereby permitted shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works on site are commenced. The development shall then be built in accordance with these approved samples.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012. These details are required prior to commencement of development because the details would affect subsequent design of other elements of the scheme and must be agreed at the outset.

The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until a scheme to enhance the nature conservation interest of the site has been submitted to and agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall include measures for Swift enhancements and shall be implemented in full prior to the occupation of the development hereby approved.Reason: To safeguard and protect the sites biodiversity and nature conservation value in accordance with Policy DM6 (Biodiversity) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to occupation of the development, the facilities for the storage of waste and recycling containers shown on the approved plans shall be fully implemented on site. Thereafter the facilities shall be permanently retained.Reason: To ensure that the development provides suitable waste and recycling storage facilities and to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policies 5.17, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS8, CS9 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Within 3 months of first occupation, evidence must be submitted to the Council confirming that the new dwelling hereby permitted has achieved no less than the C02 reductions (ENE1), internal water usage (WAT1) standards equivalent to Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4.  Evidence requirements are detailed in the "Schedule of Evidence Required for Post Construction Stage from ENE1 and WAT1 of the Code for Sustainable Homes Guide.  Evidence to demonstrate a 19% reduction compared to 2013 Part L regulations and internal water usage rates of 105L/day must be submitted to the Local Planning Authority, unless otherwise agreed in writing.Reason:  In order to ensure that all development is designed and built to make the most efficient use of resources, reduce its life cycle impact on the environment and contributes to climate change mitigation and adaptation in accordance with Policy CS1 (Climate Change Mitigation) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to occupation of the development, the cycle parking facilities shown on the approved plans shall be fully implemented on site. Thereafter the facilities shall be permanently retained.Reason: To ensure that appropriate opportunities to promote sustainable transport are taken up, in accordance with policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS6 and DM8 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
Please provide a revised copy of block plan showing the proposed works (hatched or shaded) in relation to the existing dwelling, site boundaries and any outbuildings on site.

Please provide copies of existing and proposed elevations (from the other side) at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing outline of entire property not just part and showing dimensions of proposed work. If the proposed works are not visible from the other side, please provide a shaded outline of the house.
Please provide a revised copy of proposed elevations, showing outline of entire property not just part.Please note that the submitted drawing showed part section through and not the rear elevation.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

The noise management plan  required by condition should include reference to physical and management controls as specified in the Anderson Acoustics report dated April 2019 Project No. 3161 to restrict the use of tonal reversing alarms on all vehicles used on site, including fork lift trucks and any vehicle delivering to site, staff training on traffic management on site and appropriate signage.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way.  We have made available detailed advice in the form or our statutory policies in the Core Strategy, Supplementary Planning Documents, Planning Briefs and other informal written guidance, as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works are acceptable and minor in order to maintain mature trees in rear garden of property. No effect upon public amenity.Recommendation:Refuse & grant lesser works as follows:T.1 Magnolia - 1m Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points & 10% crown thin.T.3 Yew - Crown lift to 2.5m from ground level above public footpath and raise remaining crown to match this new level.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos not provided by applicant.Assessment:Trees at very rear of back garden and not visible to the public so removal is not affecting public amenity and the use of a TPO would therefore be innapropriate.Recommendation:No objections.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works to T.3 are acceptable and minor in nature, however the applicant seeks 2m clearance between the magnolia and the house and this is too great a lateral reduction and would result in a very one sided tree.Recommendation:Refuse & grant lesser works as follows:T.1 Magnolia - 1m Holistic crown reduction to suitable growth points & 10% crown thin.T.3 Yew - Crown lift to 2.5m from ground level above public footpath and raise remaining crown to match this new level.

Inspection:Site inspection carried out as a desktop exercise due to COVID19 lockdown. Photos provided by the applicant as supporting material to application.Assessment:The works to remove the Leylandii are acceptable a sthe rooting enironment has been compromised with the tree now leaning and exibiting root plate movement which threatens to push over a second tree.Recommendation:No objections.
